unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies See Increased Uptake in Maharashtra**
normalised: energy and utilities: solar rooftop subsidies see increased uptake in maharashtra

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26, 2023 – The Maharashtra Energy Development Agency (MEDA) has reported a significant increase in the adoption of solar rooftop systems, driven by attractive government subsidies. Subsidies of up to 40% are available for residential installations up to 3 kW, and 20% for systems between 3 kW and 10 kW.
normalised: mumbai, october twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – the maharashtra energy development agency (M E D A) has reported a significant increase in the adoption of solar rooftop systems, driven by attractive government subsidies. subsidies of up to forty percent are available for residential installations up to three kilowatt, and twenty percent for systems between three kilowatt and ten kilowatt.

unnormalised: Dr. Anjali Sharma, Director of MEDA, stated, "We are witnessing a surge in applications, particularly from housing societies in Pune and Nagpur. The reduced upfront cost, coupled with lower electricity bills, makes solar rooftops an appealing option."

unnormalised: Under the Pradhan Mantri Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana, homeowners can avail subsidies ranging from Rs. 30,000 to Rs. 78,000. The initiative aims to power 1 crore households across India.
normalised: under the pradhan mantri surya ghar muft bijli yojana, homeowners can avail subsidies ranging from rupees thirty thousand to rupees seventy eight thousand. the initiative aims to power one crore households across india.

unnormalised: Analysts estimate that a typical 3 kW system can power a household consuming around 300 units monthly, and requires approximately 300 sq ft of rooftop area. Grid connectivity allows users to sell excess power back to the distribution company, further reducing their energy expenses. Several discoms like MSEDCL are streamlining the net metering process to facilitate this.
